nl.tue.geometrycore.geometryrendering

Interface GeometryRenderer<TRenderObject>

  • Type Parameters:
    TRenderObject - type of object to that can be used for custom rendering
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BaseWriter, GeometryPanel, IPEWriter, RasterWriter, SVGWriter

    public interface GeometryRenderer<TRenderObject>
    This is interface should be used for rendering as much as possible. This allows the same methods to be used to render to screen, or files, etc.
    See Also:
    BaseRenderer}, BaseWriter}

    • Method Summary

      Renders the given geometries using the current rendering settings.

      Renders the given geometries using the current rendering settings.

      Renders the given text at the specified location.

      Returns the render object used by this renderer.
      void popClipping()
      Removes the most-recently adding clipping path.
      void popGroup()
      Ends the most recently started group.
      void popMatrix()
      Removes the last applied view transformation.

      Adds a clipping path to the current rendering.
      void pushGroup()
      Combines all following draw operations into a single group, until popGroup() is called.
      void pushMatrix(java.awt.geom.AffineTransform transform)
      Applies a transformation matrix to the renderer.
      void setAlpha(double alpha)
      Configures the opacity, with 1 being fully opaque and 0 being fully transparent.

      Configures the arrowhead for the start of oriented geometries.

      Configures the fill color.

      Configures the arrowhead for the end of oriented geometries.

      Configures the point style and size.
      void setSizeMode(SizeMode sizeMode)
      Configures whether all style sizes (i.e., pointsize, arrowsize, strokewidth, dashing, hashures, textsize) are configured in worldspace or in viewspace.

      Configures the stroke style.

      Configures the appearance of text, through an anchor and text size.
      void setTextStyle(TextAnchor anchor, double textsize, FontStyle fontstyle)
      Configures the appearance of text, through an anchor and text size, and font style.

    • Method Detail

      • setAlpha

        void setAlpha(double alpha)
        Configures the opacity, with 1 being fully opaque and 0 being fully transparent.
        Parameters:
        alpha - value in [0,1]

      • setTextStyle

        void setTextStyle(TextAnchor anchor,
                  double textsize)
        Configures the appearance of text, through an anchor and text size. Font style defaults to normal text.
        Parameters:
        anchor - anchor for text placement
        textsize - size of text: world or screen space depends on setSizeMode(nl.tue.geometrycore.geometryrendering.styling.SizeMode)

      • setTextStyle

        void setTextStyle(TextAnchor anchor,
                  double textsize,
                  FontStyle fontstyle)
        Configures the appearance of text, through an anchor and text size, and font style.
        Parameters:
        anchor - anchor for text placement
        textsize - size of text: world or screen space depends on setSizeMode(nl.tue.geometrycore.geometryrendering.styling.SizeMode)
        fontstyle - which type of font to use

      • setSizeMode

        void setSizeMode(SizeMode sizeMode)
        Configures whether all style sizes (i.e., pointsize, arrowsize, strokewidth, dashing, hashures, textsize) are configured in worldspace or in viewspace.
        Parameters:
        sizeMode - new mode for sizing

      • setStroke

        void setStroke(java.awt.Color color,
               double strokewidth,
               Dashing dash)
        Configures the stroke style. Set color to null to disable stroke. Setting the dash parameter to null gives a solid line.
        Parameters:
        color - stroke color
        strokewidth - width: world or screen space depends on setSizeMode(nl.tue.geometrycore.geometryrendering.styling.SizeMode)
        dash - dashing style

      • setFill

        void setFill(java.awt.Color color,
             Hashures hash)
        Configures the fill color. Set color to null to disable fill. Set hash to null to use a solid fill.
        Parameters:
        color - fill color
        hash - hashures: world or screen space depends on setSizeMode(nl.tue.geometrycore.geometryrendering.styling.SizeMode)

      • setPointStyle

        void setPointStyle(PointStyle pointstyle,
                   double pointsize)
        Configures the point style and size.
        Parameters:
        pointstyle - point style
        pointsize - scaling factor: world or screen space depends on setSizeMode(nl.tue.geometrycore.geometryrendering.styling.SizeMode)

      • setBackwardArrowStyle

        void setBackwardArrowStyle(ArrowStyle arrow,
                           double arrowsize)
        Configures the arrowhead for the start of oriented geometries. Set arrow to null to disable this arrowhead.
        Parameters:
        arrow - style of the arrowhead
        arrowsize - scaling factor: world or screen space depends on setSizeMode(nl.tue.geometrycore.geometryrendering.styling.SizeMode)

      • setForwardArrowStyle

        void setForwardArrowStyle(ArrowStyle arrow,
                          double arrowsize)
        Configures the arrowhead for the end of oriented geometries. Set arrow to null to disable this arrowhead.
        Parameters:
        arrow - style of the arrowhead
        arrowsize - scaling factor: world or screen space depends on setSizeMode(nl.tue.geometrycore.geometryrendering.styling.SizeMode)

      • pushMatrix

        void pushMatrix(java.awt.geom.AffineTransform transform)
        Applies a transformation matrix to the renderer. Calls to pushMatrix(java.awt.geom.AffineTransform) and popMatrix(), pushClipping(nl.tue.geometrycore.geometry.GeometryConvertable) and popClipping(), and pushGroup() and popGroup() should follow a combined proper nesting structure.
        Parameters:
        transform -

      • popMatrix

        void popMatrix()
        Removes the last applied view transformation. Calls to pushMatrix(java.awt.geom.AffineTransform) and popMatrix(), pushClipping(nl.tue.geometrycore.geometry.GeometryConvertable) and popClipping(), and pushGroup() and popGroup() should follow a combined proper nesting structure.

      • pushClipping

        void pushClipping(GeometryConvertable geometry)
        Adds a clipping path to the current rendering. Calls to pushMatrix(java.awt.geom.AffineTransform) and popMatrix(), pushClipping(nl.tue.geometrycore.geometry.GeometryConvertable) and popClipping(), and pushGroup() and popGroup() should follow a combined proper nesting structure.
        Parameters:
        geometry - clipping path

      • popClipping

        void popClipping()
        Removes the most-recently adding clipping path. Calls to pushMatrix(java.awt.geom.AffineTransform) and popMatrix(), pushClipping(nl.tue.geometrycore.geometry.GeometryConvertable) and popClipping(), and pushGroup() and popGroup() should follow a combined proper nesting structure.

      • pushGroup

        void pushGroup()
        Combines all following draw operations into a single group, until popGroup() is called. Calls to pushMatrix(java.awt.geom.AffineTransform) and popMatrix(), pushClipping(nl.tue.geometrycore.geometry.GeometryConvertable) and popClipping(), and pushGroup() and popGroup() should follow a combined proper nesting structure.

      • popGroup

        void popGroup()
        Ends the most recently started group. Calls to pushMatrix(java.awt.geom.AffineTransform) and popMatrix(), pushClipping(nl.tue.geometrycore.geometry.GeometryConvertable) and popClipping(), and pushGroup() and popGroup() should follow a combined proper nesting structure.

      • draw

        void draw(java.util.Collection<? extends GeometryConvertable> geometries)
        Renders the given geometries using the current rendering settings.
        Parameters:
        geometries - geometries to be drawn

      • draw

        void draw(GeometryConvertable... geometries)
        Renders the given geometries using the current rendering settings.
        Parameters:
        geometries - geometries to be drawn

      • draw

        void draw(Vector location,
          java.lang.String text)
        Renders the given text at the specified location.
        Parameters:
        location - position of the text anchor
        text - string of text to be rendered

      • getRenderObject

        TRenderObject getRenderObject()
        Returns the render object used by this renderer. This object can be used for more customized render handling, but breaks from the genericity of renderers. For advanced use only. May return null.
        Returns:
        object for custom rendering
